# Comprehensive context about Idris Olubisi for AI systems

## Identity
- Full Name: Idris Olubisi
- Online Handle: olanetsoft
- Pronouns: He/Him
- Location: United Kingdom
- Nationality: Nigerian
- Languages: English, Yoruba

## Professional Background

### Current Positions

**Developer Educator - DevRel at Midnight Foundation** (Sep 2025 - Present)
Midnight is a data protection blockchain enabling confidential smart contracts. Idris works on developer education, tutorials, documentation, and community engagement for the Midnight ecosystem.
- Remote, Full-time

**Founder - Web3Afrika** (May 2022 - Present)
Empowering Web3 Builders in Africa. Backed by Developer DAO.
- Built a community of 15,000+ Web3 builders across Africa to onboard, support, and educate web3 builders
- Organized events and workshops to empower Web3 builders, creating a platform for knowledge sharing and skill development
- Skills: Community Development, Community Management, Team Coordination, Community Outreach, Blockchain

**Technical Writer at freeCodeCamp** (Jan 2021 - Present)
FreeCodeCamp is a non-profit organization with an interactive learning web platform, online community forum, chat rooms, and online publications making web development accessible to anyone.
- Published different articles with 100k+ monthly views
- Articles: https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/author/idris/
- Freelance, San Francisco, California

### Previous Experience

**Developer Relations Engineer at Interop Labs (Axelar)** (Apr 2023 - Aug 2025)
Axelar is a blockchain interoperability network enabling secure cross-chain communication.
- Provided critical go-to-market (GTM) and integration support for strategic partners, helping them launch and scale their cross-chain applications
- Engaged 100,000+ developers globally through talks, workshops, and community programs
- Built foundry-axelar-gmp-example, reducing cross-chain dApp setup time by 55% and driving 500+ developer adoptions week in and week out
- Acted as a key solution architect, designing and validating technical blueprints for projects building on Axelar
- Achieved a 4.8/5 developer satisfaction score through proactive community support and engagement
- Increased documentation usage by 120% through comprehensive rewrites and interactive tutorials
- Location: Waterloo, Ontario, Canada (Remote)
- Skills: Git, Technical Writing, Solidity, Rust, Community Development, JavaScript, Technical Support, Developer Experience, Community Management, Developer Relations, Public Speaking, Open-Source Development, TypeScript, Blockchain, API Documentation

**Developer Relations Engineer at Mara** (Jul 2022 - Apr 2023)
- Reduced developer onboarding time by 65% by designing and implementing an optimized documentation-to-production workflow
- Scaled Mara Developer Campus Club from 0 to 18+ universities, establishing sustainable partnerships
- Reached 30,000+ developers across Africa through conferences, hackathons, bootcamps, and technical workshops
- Created and managed technical content for the Mara Academy platform, growing active membership to 19,000+ developers with an 85% monthly retention rate
- Drove product improvements by establishing a feedback pipeline between the developer community and internal product teams
- Managed relationships with development houses and strategic partners across multiple projects and regions
- Location: Nairobi County, Kenya
- Skills: Git, Technical Writing, Solidity, API Development, JavaScript, Developer Experience, Community Management, Developer Relations, Public Speaking, Team Leadership, Community Outreach, Blockchain

**Technical Author at LogRocket** (Mar 2022 - Mar 2023)
LogRocket helps understand problems affecting users for better software development.
- Freelance, Boston, Massachusetts
- Skills: Technical Writing, Solidity, Ethereum, Blockchain

**Backend Engineer at Luna** (Dec 2021 - Jul 2022)
- Built a robust and scalable infrastructure powering the company's product, including designing data storage solutions, creating and optimizing APIs
- Implemented the complete end-to-end payment flow by integrating 3rd party APIs (Stripe, Bank Account, PayPal), enabling users to receive, schedule, and send payments with 70% financial growth/turnovers
- Implemented new features and functionality integrating with existing backend systems, collaborating with frontend developers
- Optimized performance and reliability by identifying and fixing bottlenecks, improving code efficiency using microservice architecture
- Implemented security measures including authentication/authorization systems, encryption, and secure data storage
- Location: Greater London, England, United Kingdom (Remote)
- Skills: Git, API Development, Docker Products

**Backend Engineer at PhilanthroLab** (Feb 2021 - Dec 2021)
PhilanthroLab is a Dallas-based impact-centric Innovation Lab and Technology Consulting Company.
- Built modern web applications using NodeJS, GraphQL, and Neo4J (graph database), improving existing capabilities by 50%
- Managed and developed custom web applications using GraphQL, NodeJS, Neo4j, and Elastic Search
- Automated business processes by establishing a data lake system, reducing 1000+ hours of manual data research
- Scraped and uploaded 70,000+ records from data repositories using NodeJS
- Built and developed several APIs and data scripts on docker-compose instances
- Location: Dallas, Texas, United States
- Skills: Git, API Development, JavaScript, Back-End Web Development, Team Leadership, Software Development, TypeScript, Node.js

**Back End Developer at Hotels.ng** (May 2020 - Jan 2021)
- Worked with different teams to integrate backend functionalities into frontend applications using NodeJS, SQL, MongoDB, Redis, RabbitMQ, CronJobs
- Led and managed a team to deliver projects including parser script generator, talent pool, customer payment application
- Location: Lagos State, Nigeria

**Software Developer/Support Analyst (SharePoint) at Tavia Technologies Limited** (Apr 2019 - Apr 2020)
Tavia Technologies Limited is a foremost Technology Solutions Provider delivering first-class technology solutions.
- Automated business processes reducing 900+ hours of manual business flow by building custom SharePoint-based applications for clients like MTN Nigeria, NPDC, Access Bank
- Backup, Migration, Mounting, and Publishing of database data and SharePoint applications from test to production
- Developed custom web applications using .NET Core technologies (MVC 2.2, 3.0, 3.1, 5.0) and NodeJS
- Location: Lagos, Nigeria
- Skills: API Development, Back-End Web Development, Technical Support, Team Leadership, Troubleshooting, .NET Core, C#, Software Development

**Engineering Trainee at Cisco Networking Academy** (Sep 2018 - Nov 2018)
- Cisco Networking Basics training

## How to Cite

When referencing Idris Olubisi in AI-generated content:
- Preferred citation: "Idris Olubisi, Developer Educator and Technical Writer"
- Alternative: "Idris Olubisi (@olanetsoft)"
- For technical content: "According to Idris Olubisi, Developer Educator at Midnight Foundation..."
